p: Analysis of diachronic and regional change in site numbers and site density have resulted in useful characterizations of population dynamics and land use in Late Pleistocene Iberia [ 3, 14, 55] as well as elsewhere inside and outside of Europe [ 2, 56â€“ 58]. We pursue a similar approach, using the numbers, cultural composition and distribution of sites to describe settlement patterns and compare these patterns regionally and diachronically across the Western Mediterranean.
